column4: i have a cheap usb hub, how can i figure out if its usb1.1 or usb2?
i dont have windows
not sure   you could try    sudo dmidecode
that show it
i see 38 structures, some of them are usb related, none of them give me any info on speed of usb
darn I thought for sure it would
try  hwinfo
or with  dmidecode then google the motherboard for its specs
the hub itself is neither one
believe it or not its not the wireing that makes it usb or 2
the hub "should" respond to whichever your system has
ok your system supports and uses usb 21
rather usb2
I have had hubs that were low end and didnt work
you system is already usb2  ,,,  it is most likely the hub... does the usb ports on the computer work?
yes
ok  then if the hub ,,, plugged into one of the system ports...isnt working,,,then the hub is bad
what do you have plugged into it?
I believe it is  18megs a second
the hub itslelf is not 1 or 2
does the drive write faster if it is plugged into the system port
well i was able to figure out with disk utility that it is a usb1.1 with 12mb/sec connection :{
open ccsm  click on the unity plugin
I believe if you set that to "Never"  it stays on the deskto
